channel.title: Any of you play an instrument?
channel.description:
I was wondering if any of you have played (or are still playing) an instrument. I'm thinking of learning either drums or bass guitar, so if any of you play those could you also tell me how long you've been playing and how you went about learning it?
Electronic music also counts as an instrument... tell us what equipment/software you use :p

item.title: Any of you play an instrument?
item.dc:creator: @The_Boss2 The_Boss
item.description:
@The_Boss2 wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:11, topic:524741”][quote author=Chrix link=topic=643398.msg4331181#msg4331181 date=1373664631]
I play drums they are alot of fun, you should buy a 5 piece drumset and try it out (only costs 300-500 dollars depending).
[/quote]

I’m not going to pay 300-500 dollars to try somthing out
I do like drums though… tried it out at my friend’s place.
The reason why I’m probably going for a bass guitar is because my mom won’t let me buy a drumset because we don’t have any space for it xD[/quote] One time I paid $500 to try heroin, the rest is history

Read full topic
item.source: Any of you play an instrument?

item.title: Any of you play an instrument?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:31, topic:524741”]I don’t mean to brag, but…

I’ve played guitar for 10 years, bass for about 4, drums for 6, and piano for 1. I also sing - clean and raspy. I’ve written and recorded 2 full albums and am working on my third. Including all of those songs, I’ve attempted to write 147 of them using Guitar Pro. I was in a couple bands for a while and with my longest one, we wrote 4 songs. I played lead guitar and sang in it.

Yeah…[/quote]

Don’t know man, why don’t you show us some vocals then?

Read full topic
item.source: Any of you play an instrument?

item.title: Any of you play an instrument?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

I bought a guitar years back around Kaitnieks/Mitb crossover time, but it was the cheapest guitar that money could buy and wasn’t nice to play on, sure, if it was properly adjusted it would have been fine but it put me off trying to learn an instrument for a long time.

For the past year I’ve wanted to learn an instrument properly and it was a tossup between a violin, guitar or bass, I bit the bullet and went for a bass. I’ve had it for a few weeks now and have only played it for a few hours, I’d play more but my plan of using Youtube tuition/online tutorials backfired when I couldn’t find a properly structured lesson aimed for beginners.

Another problem I’m sure any guitarist can relate to: I can play for about an hour until I can’t use my left hand anymore. I know that if I keep playing the skin on my fingers will toughen up, I just happen to have really shitty skin that cuts/tears easy which doesn’t help the problem.

Read full topic
item.source: Any of you play an instrument?

item.title: Any of you play an instrument?
item.dc:creator: @Lin Lin
item.description:
@Lin wrote:

I don’t mean to brag, but…

I’ve played guitar for 10 years, bass for about 4, drums for 6, and piano for 1. I also sing - clean and raspy. I’ve written and recorded 2 full albums and am working on my third. Including all of those songs, I’ve attempted to write 147 of them using Guitar Pro. I was in a couple bands for a while and with my longest one, we wrote 4 songs. I played lead guitar and sang in it.

Yeah…

Read full topic

item.title: Any of you play an instrument?
item.dc:creator: @Fire_capez Fire capez
item.description:
@Fire_capez wrote:

Hello, as evident by the amount of time this week I have been spending on moparscape, I myself am interesting in learning to play an instrument. I think I will most likely learn how to play the violin, my plan is to learn how the actual instrument works itself (the history of it, its construction) how sound works (acoustics) and music theory to read sheets - this sounds rather plausible to me but i’m not musically inclined:

Does the above sound like a relatively good way or would it be a waste of time? (would it be better to just spend the time practising)

Read full topic
item.source: Any of you play an instrument?

item.title: Any of you play an instrument?
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“Arcik, post:26, topic:524741”]I don’t think using online equipment counts as an instrument, unless you call clicking a few buttons whatever.
Singing is way better.[/quote]

It may not be a physical instrument, but the difficulty and flexibility of the software demands you to respect the people who actually know how to use it.
The notes you play on a physical instrument are also played on a virtual instrument, so it’s less or more the same.

Read full topic

item.title: Any of you play an instrument?
item.dc:creator: @Bl3nd Bl3nd
item.description:
@Bl3nd wrote:

For electronic music, I make Dubstep and House. How I do it, Either Fl Studio or Ableton (this is a more advanced program). For my plug-ins I mostly use Native Instruments Massive. I’ve been doing this since I was 14. I started because these genres just sounded sick to find out to make. Anyway, you should check Fl Studio out. You can make any genre you want.

Read full topic

item.title: Any of you play an instrument?
item.dc:creator: @Mikeyzzz Mikeyzzz
item.description:
@Mikeyzzz wrote:

[quote=“Cres, post:7, topic:524741”]@Ambokile
How do you teach yourself? Youtube videos/reading books?

@Mikeyzzz
Nice Is it a difficult instrument? I really want to try it… I’m buying a bass somewhere next month :D[/quote]

Do this:

[quote=“Ambokile, post:9, topic:524741”][quote author=Cres link=topic=643398.msg4330969#msg4330969 date=1373650652]@Ambokile
How do you teach yourself? Youtube videos/reading books?[/quote]

I listen to a song and look up tabs for it, then I try to emulate their technique[/quote]And in relation to difficulty, it is a really simple instrument, no need for all those chords and what not. I’ve played guitar and Bass, bass is my preference.

Read full topic
